content.description: Climb the easy arching slab crack up to the base of the crack. This line climbs the right crack that starts with a few moves off fingers and quickly moves left on a laybacking rail as the crack gets wider, finish with an OW squeeze!
content.protection: Single rack with doubles in big hands and #4s

climbs.name: Pond Scum Smoothie
climbs.fa: P1 Zach Nadiak, P2 Slator Aplin, Jack Plantz

content.description:
Pond Scum Smoothie climbs the SW face of the Butt Crack Butte up the left crack.

5th class sandstone slab leads to the base of a short hands/big hands crack with an OW finish.
content.protection:
Single rack to #4 (optional #6 for OW finish)

Single 60m rap off Cord/tat slung block on top down East side of Butte.

content.description: This route goes up the west side of the butt crack butte and is noticeably chossy. Although cleaned on rappel there are still loose flakes and blocks on the route giving it the R rating. Only 2 points of aid used to avoid loose rock and to pull past the first slab bulge. Climb the left side of the choss mountain for best gear and rock quality.. if that even exists?
content.protection:
Doubles in tight to big hands, singles in small gear. Single hook if you dont feel comfy pulling the beginning slab with no gear.

Rap with single 60m rope off cord/tat slung block on summit.
